str2: Early in the morning, at dawn. Adverb from pro; at dawn; by implication, the day-break watch.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From epi and anago; to lead up on, i.e. to put out; to return.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be hungry, needy, desire earnestly. From the same as penes; to famish; figuratively, to crave.
